snippet.title: Super Stardust 96 - World 1
snippet.description:
The first world from Super Stardust 96, by Housemarque.

Of all the old Stardust games, Super Stardust 96 for PC computers was the supreme version. It had everything its predecessors had but added more features, gameplay, special effects, colors and animation.

Advertised as "the first true arcade shoot-em-up for PC", the game was both a critical and commercial success. The game received rave reviews and was considered one of the most technically impressive PC games ever.

Players controlled their trusty starship which they could upgrade with 5 different weapons, missiles and shields.

The game featured 5 different worlds and 30 levels full of asteroids, enemies and end-of-level bosses. The worlds were connected by 3D hyperspace tunnels with huge asteroids, enemies and bosses hurtling toward the player.

True arcade game quality experience for your home PC!

• 5 worlds with 30 levels and dazzling warp tunnel sequences
• Detailed 3D graphics and animation with real-time glow & transparency effects
• Huge selection of weapons and ship upgrades
• 70 Hz screen updating

"Easily the funnest fun seen on the zap-game scene"-- 90% PC Gamer April 1996
(No #60 out of 100 TOP 100 PC games of all time in June 1996)

88% Games Master May 1996

88% PC Format July 1996

Computer Player (U.S) "CP Recommended" Award Spring 1996
